com.threecrickets.prudence.cache
Class SqlCache

java.lang.Object
  com.threecrickets.prudence.cache.SqlCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cache
Direct Known Subclasses:
H2Cache
public class SqlCache
extends Object
implements Cache

A SQL-backed cache. Internally uses Apache Commons DBCP for connection pooling.

This instance maintains a pool of read/write locks to guarantee atomicity of storing, fetching and invalidating. It does not use SQL transactions. This allows you disable transaction features in your database for better performance. However, it also means that you should not have more than one instance of this class working on the same set of keys, because they will not be sharing the locks.

Also note that prune() does not clean up unused locks. Since most applications reuse cache keys anyway, this seems like an insignificant "memory leak" cost in order to vastly improve pruning performance.

Author:
Tal Liron

store

public void store(String key,
                  CacheEntry entry)
Description copied from interface: Cache
Stores an entry in the cache. The entry is guaranteed to be un-fetchable after CacheEntry.getExpirationDate(), although it may very well be un-fetchable sooner.

Keys are unique to the cache. Storing for a key that already exists will replace the entry if it exists.

Specified by:
store in interface Cache
Parameters:
key - A key unique to the cache
entry - The entry
